article_title: Two Female Finnish Relief Workers Killed in Afghanistan
article_text:
Two Finnish women were gunned down and killed by unknown assailants in western Afghanistan on Thursday, the latest in a string of attacks on foreigners in the country.

The women, middle-aged relief workers with a Christian charity, were in a taxi in the city of Herat when two men on a motorcycle opened fire, according to Afghan and Finnish officials. They died shortly afterward. There was no indication of the motive behind the...
